heading: 1.1 OpenLandMap project
text:
OpenLandMap Open Land Data services providing access spatial layers
covering global land mass (spatial resolutions 1 km, 250 m, 100 m, 30 m finer) hosted OpenGeoHub foundation, GILAB.rs collaborators.
aims becoming OpenStreetMap-type system land data. Access spatial layers 
possible via interactive visualizations /Open Source software solutions.
Read project .OpenLandMap layers, specified otherwise, licensed 
Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International license (CC -SA) /
Open Data Commons Open Database License (ODbL). implies anyone can use,
build upon, OpenLandMap data without restrictions.
See Copyright License page details.
Figure 1.1: Example 3D soil information: soil pH visualized different depths.
Users can access OpenLandMap data via five main channels:OpenLandMap App https://openlandmap.org,OpenLandMap training points https://github.com/openlandmap/compiled-ess-point-data-sets,OpenGeoHub STAC installation https://stac.opengeohub.org,Zenodo.org access (version-controlled) back-copy data via DOI,Data portal https://openlandmap.org landing page (running Geoserver + OpenLayers) users can browse maps, query values 
location, find recent news activities. STAC https://stac.opengeohub.org
generic layer repository accessing layers installed maintained OpenGeoHub.
allow users .e.Â producers layers edit update metadata descriptions,
create map views, learn use WCS, WMS similar. copy raw data can obtained
via zenodo.org similar public data repositories.training data repository contains
import processing steps run clean standardize global compilations training
points, importantly land cover, vegetation, meteo, soil similar observations.

heading: 1.2 Layers and themes of interest
text:
OpenLandMap.org provides access global environmental layers focused land surface.
aiming serving Analysis-Ready, Cloud-Optimized (ARCO) data passes four simple C checks (4C):
(1) completeness (meaning: data available least 99% pixels interest),
(2) consistency (meaning: consistent file names, variable names relationships,
everything documented via metadata), (3) currency (context: user
using --date version data), (4) correctness (context:
making sure served data correct / highest possible quality version).
words, ARCO version data something highest quality,
fully documented optimized web-services / advanced analysis.Thus, following five primary requirements need satisfied layer can considered inclusion:Global coverage least 98% land mask represented layer (-NA values).Open Data license.Metadata supplied following format specified (columns filled---date).Sufficient technical documentation supplied â€” usually scientific paper report.GDAL/proj4-compatible data format projection system used allows inclusion Geoserver similar.layers organized around following themes
(based UN-GGIM Global Fundamental Geospatial Data Themes):
- Buildings Settlements,
- Elevation Depth,
- Geology Soils,
- Land Cover Land Use,
- Population Distribution,
- Water,
- Physical Infrastructure,
- Climate (added entry),
- Biodiversity Nature Conservation (added entry),layers maybe match two themes difficult classify using 
simple definition.

heading: 1.3 Accessing data
text:
OpenLandMap data can best accessed using OpenLandMap S3 file service.
service based Cloud-Optimized GeoTIFFs 
probably also best solution spatial queries spatial analysis.connect use data seamlessly code, recommend using STAC tools e.g.Â 
RStac access OpenLanMap catalog
program analysis using --date version data. 
can use https://s3.eu-central-1.wasabisys.com/stac/openlandmap/catalog.json 
collection_id (example: fapar_essd.lstm) access description data 
URLs filenames S3.

heading: 1.3.1 Accessing data from Zenodo
text:
download whole layers zenodo can use R packages jsonlite RCurl:first need authenticate using Zenodo API TOKEN
(see: obtain API TOKEN):download MODIS LST images 1 km can use bucket ID dep.id = "1435938" gives:shows total 102 files folder. download temperatures August,
hence use:gives total 9 files:can test accessing file using:files can downloaded using download.file(tif, basename(tif)) function similar.
also R package Zenodo zen4R
makes downloading files even easier. python can also library
zen especially useful
uploading large data sets Zenodo.
code:
library(jsonlite)
library(RCurl)
library(rgdal)
TOKEN = scan("~/TOKEN_ACCESS", what="character")dep.id = "1435938"
x = fromJSON(system(paste0('curl -H \"Accept: application/json\" -H \"Authorization: Bearer ', 
        TOKEN, '\" \"https://zenodo.org/api/deposit/depositions/', dep.id, '\"'), intern=TRUE))

heading: 1.3.2 Accessing data from Google Earth Engine
text:
Google Earth Engine users can access snapshot OpenLandMap.org layers using following address:https://code.earthengine.google.com/?asset=users/opengeohub/openlandmapDescription layer names units used can find .
Note sync layers OpenLandMap.org Google Earth Engine done
year, hence, wish use --date layers moment,
downloading maps either Zenodo via Wasabi service recommended.access OpenLandMap layers can also refer public data sets :https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/datasets/tags/openlandmap

heading: 1.4 The file naming convention
text: OpenLandMap file-naming convention works 10 fields basically define important properties data (way users can search files, prepare data analysis etc, without even needing access open files. 10 fields include:Generic variable name (needs unique): lcluVariable procedure combination .e.Â method standard (standard abbreviation): esa.cciPosition probability distribution / variable type: cSpatial support (usually horizontal block) m km: 250mDepth reference depth interval e.g.Â (â€œbâ€), (â€œâ€) ground surface (â€œsâ€) b{depth}{metric length} certain depth. e.g.Â b30cm. interval like go b{depth}t{depth}{metric length}: b30t60cmTime reference begin time (YYYYMMDD): 20210101Time reference end time: 20211231Bounding box (2 letters max): goEPSG code: epsg.4326Version code .e.Â creation date: v20221015An example file-name based description :following variable types currently supported:m= mean value;q.10 = 10% probability quantile (one side probability);d= median value; equivalent q.50;c= class factor / requires domain codes / levels;cd = change class (special cross-domain 2D matrix);p= probability 0â€“100%;sse = Shannon Scaled Entropy index;l.159= lower 68% probability threshold (quantile);u.841= upper 68% probability threshold (quantile), one-sided probability use â€œqâ€,pc= percent cover pixel 0â€“100%;sd= standard deviation prediction error; multiple standard deviation use e.g.Â â€œsd.2â€md = model deviation (case ensemble predictions);si= confidence interval range prediction mean value;td = cumulative difference (usually based time-series values);Note file naming convention following properties:Large quantities files can easily sorted searched (one line queries Bash).File-naming patterns can used seamlessly build virtual mosaics composites.Key spatiotemporal properties data available file name e.g.Â variable type, O&M method, spatial resolution, bounding box, projection system, temporal references. Users can program analysis without opening testing files.Versioning system ubiquitous.file-names unique.Geonetwork STAC used link unique file names : (1) WPs, deliverables, themes / keywords, (2) DOIâ€™s, (3) project homepages, (4) contact pages support feedback. keywords recommend using INSPIRE keywords. confirm metadata complete consistent, recommend using INSPIRE metadata validator /https://data.europa.eu/en validator.simple additional rules generating file name include:Codes abbreviations human-readable much possible (hence short, short!);Use English-US (en-us) language e.g.Â months use â€œjanâ€, â€œfebâ€ etc;Consistently use UNICODE standard: non-ASCII characters;Limit total file name size characters : 256;time reference extend beyond hour minute timezone;non-standard non-EPSG projections please register projection first obtain code Spatial Reference List;bounding boxes use much possible 2â€“letter unique country code; continents use Equi7 Grid codes global products use â€œgoâ€ global land without Antarctica, â€œgaâ€ full global coverage,method codes use much possible unique IDs ISO - ICS;MODIS products use consistently MODIS products codes e.g.Â MOD11A2 v061;long-term aggregates seasonal, monthly, weekly values use period name end method names (#3) example long-term estimate MODIS LST daytime temperature month August:list vocabularies used abbreviated names variables provided OpenGeoHub. file-name convention described can also used vector data (different file extension) also.

deserts 2000â€“2015)3 = permanent bare areas (consistently bare areas /
deserts 2000â€“2015)4 = permanent ice (consistently ice 2000â€“2015)4 = permanent ice (consistently ice 2000â€“2015)need global equal area projection (e.g.Â able derive total stocks / density features N/km-squared)

heading: 1.6 Cloud-optimized GeoTIFF
text:
layers included OpenLandMap system pre-processed following GDALâ€™s cloud-optimized GeoTIFF
instructions. process large (global land mask 250 m resolution finer) GeoTIFFs please use following
settings:prepare cloud-optimized GeoTIFF use:add tiles optimize compression. CO=YES indicates GeoTIFF cloud-optimized.OpenLandMap.org COGâ€™s available publicly without restrictions via 
Wasabi file service.
code:
gdalwarp layer.vrt layer.tif 
   -ot COG
   -tr 0.002083333 0.002083333 
   -te -180.00000 -62.00081 179.99994 87.37000
   -wm 2000 -co \"BIGTIFF=YES\"gdaladdo layer.tif -r near 2 4 8 16 32 64 128
gdal_translate layer.tif layer-co.tif -mo \"CO=YES\" -co \"TILED=YES\" -co \"BLOCKXSIZE=512\" 
        -co \"BLOCKYSIZE=512\" -co \"COMPRESS=LZW\" -co \"COPY_SRC_OVERVIEWS=YES\" 
        --config GDAL_TIFF_OVR_BLOCKSIZE 512

heading: Contributing data
text:
encourage public private entities help project share SSL data.
following four modes data sharing especially encouraged:Open data releasing Creative Commons (CC-, CC--SA)
Open Data Commons Open Database License (ODbL).
data can directly imported OSSL.Donate small part (e.g.Â 5%) data (release CC-, CC--SA /ODbL).
data can directly imported OSSL.Allow openlandmap.org project direct access data can run data mining
release results data mining Open Data license.Use OpenLandMap data produce new derivative products, share 
infrastructures contact us providing hosting support.can sign professional Data Sharing Agreements data producers
specify detail data used. primary interest enabling research,
sharing use models (calibration prediction) collaboration groups
across borders.take especial care data secured, encrypted necessary,
kept safely, closely following privacy policy terms use.

heading: 3.1.8 Monthly fraction of absorbed photosynthetically active radiation (FAPAR)
text: ğŸ”— URL: https://stac.openlandmap.org/fapar_essd.lstm/collection.jsonğŸ“° Description: monthly aggregated Fraction Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation (FAPAR) dataset derived 250m 8d GLASS V6 FAPAR, considering several FAPAR products (MODIS Collection 6, GLASS FAPAR V5, PROBA-V1 FAPAR) generate bidirectional long-short-term memory (Bi-LSTM) model adjust harmonize FAPAR across two decades. monthly aggregation includes three standard statistics: (1) 5th percentile (p05), median (p50), 95th percentile (p95). month, aggregate composites within month plus one composite , ending 5 6 composites single month depending number images within month.ğŸ“ Theme: Biodiversity Nature ConservationğŸ“‚ DOI: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.8408654

text: ğŸ”— URL: https://stac.openlandmap.org/pft.landcover_esa.cci.lc/collection.jsonğŸ— Description: dataset contains Global Plant Functional Types (PFT) data, ESA Medium Resolution Land Cover (MRLC) Climate Change Initiative project. data provides yearly data, initially covers time period 1992 2020. anticipated dataset updated annually going forward. PFT v2.0.8 global dataset 14 layers, describing percentage cover (0-100%) plant functional type spatial resolution 300 m: broadleaved evergreen trees, broadleaved deciduous trees, needleleaved evergreen trees, needleleaved deciduous trees, broadleaved evergreen shrubs, broadleaved deciduous shrubs, needleleaved evergreen shrubs, needleleaved deciduous shrubs, natural grasses, herbaceous cropland (.e., managed grasses), built, water, bare areas, snow ice.ğŸ“ Theme: Land Cover Land UseğŸ“‚ DOI: https://doi.org/10.5285/26a0f46c95ee4c29b5c650b129aab788

heading: 3.1.30 SM2RAIN long-term precipitation
text: ğŸ”— URL: https://stac.openlandmap.org/precipitation_sm2rain.ltm/collection.jsonğŸ— Description: Monthly precipitation mm 1 km resolution based SM2RAIN-ASCAT 2007-2021 (https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.2615278). Downscaled 1 km resolution using gdalwarp (cubic splines) combined WorldClim (https://worldclim.org/data/worldclim21.html) CHELSA Climate (https://chelsa-climate.org/downloads/) monthly values. Final values estimated simple average three precipitation data sources; objective approach use training points e.g.Â meteo-station monthly values, train ensemble model using 3 data sources independent variables. Another global data source precipitation images monthly IMERGE dataset, however requires transformation available limited span years.ğŸ“ Theme: ClimateğŸ“‚ DOI: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.6458580

Future projections (RCP 8.5) cover two different epochs: 2041 - 2060 2061 - 2080ğŸ“ Theme: Biodiversity Nature ConservationğŸ“‚ DOI: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7822868

heading: 3.1.62 GLC_FCS30D annual land land-cover dynamic monitoring product
text: ğŸ”— URL: https://stac.openlandmap.org/lc_glc.fcs30d/collection.jsonğŸ“° Description: GLC_FCS30D first global fine land cover dynamic product 30-meter resolution adopts continuous change detection. utilizes refined classification system containing 35 land-cover categories covers time span 1985 2022. year 2000, update cycle every 5 years, 2000, updated annually. specific, developed combining continuous change detection method, local adaptive updating models spatiotemporal optimization algorithm dense time-series Landsat imagery, validated achieve overall accuracy 80.88% (Â±0.27%) basic classification system 10 major land-cover types) 73.24% (Â±0.30%) LCCS level-1 validation system (17 LCCS land-cover types).ğŸ“ Theme: Land Cover Land UseğŸ“‚ DOI: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.8239305

heading: 3.1.63 VIIRS annual nighttime lights
text: ğŸ”— URL: https://stac.openlandmap.org/nightlights.average_viirs.v21/collection.jsonğŸ“° Description: Annual Visible Night Light (VNL) V2 (VIIRS) images 500-m spatial resolution period 2012 2021 (Elvidge et al., 2021) used extrapolate values backwards years 2000â€“2011. done fitting logistic regression (per pixel) predicting values previous years. Use caution: extrapolation values can lead artifacts. land surface, however, appears growth night lights follows exponential growth function hence nights past can represented accurately fitting decay / logistic regression function.ğŸ“ Theme: OrthoimageryğŸ“‚ DOI: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.8277198

heading: 3.1.64 VIIRS long-term nighttime lights difference
text: ğŸ”— URL: https://stac.openlandmap.org/nightlights.difference_viirs.v21/collection.jsonğŸ— Description: dataset derived difference average years 2020 / 2021 years 2000 / 2021, showing average rate change 22 years period. Use caution: extrapolation values can lead artifacts. land surface, however, appears growth night lights follows exponential growth function hence nights past can represented accurately fitting decay / logistic regression function.ğŸ“ Theme: OrthoimageryğŸ“‚ DOI: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.8277198

heading: 4 OpenLandMap STAC
text: reading work--progress OpenLandMap.org Open Land Data Services. chapter currently draft version, peer-review publication pending. can find polished first edition https://openlandmap.github.io/book/.

heading: 4.1 Listing layers
text:
Thanks STAC functionality RStac package, possible query directly
collections available stac.OpenLandMap.org (Note: layers 
available STAC, might available front-end / web-GIS):example, list layers collection_id matching land cover annual
time-series lc_glc.fcs30d, can use e.g.:
code:
library(rstac)
s_obj <- stac("https://s3.eu-central-1.wasabisys.com/stac/openlandmap/")
collections(s_obj)
#> ###RSTACQuery
#> - url: https://s3.eu-central-1.wasabisys.com/stac/openlandmap/
#> - params:
#> - field(s): version, base_url, endpoint, params, verb, encode

heading: 4.2 Spatial overlay
text:
overlay multiple new points COGs, can create new function:needs URL address COGs S3 storage longitude 
latitude query points (WGS84 system). example query 
land cover classes 1985 2022:
